about.title: About We Dispatch
about.note: We help truck owners and fleets of any size earn more through smarter routing, reliable brokers, and 24/7 support.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.note: Maximize driver earnings and reduce downtime through proactive market analysis, transparent communication, and lane-first planning.

mission_stats.title: Transparency
mission_stats.note: Only clear terms. Every load is booked after your confirmation.

mission_stats.title: Earnings First
mission_stats.note: We time the market and build load chains to raise your revenue.

milestones.text: Company founded by dispatchers with long-haul experience.
Developed lane-first booking strategy across all 48 states.
Helped carriers raise average gross by 20% through optimized booking.
Onboarded 100+ carrier partners and scaled dedicated dispatcher teams.

questions.a: Yes. Many roles are remote in US time; some require presence in Chișinău or IL.

questions.a: Yes. Onboarding lasts 7–14 days with a mentor, access to scripts, and call breakdowns.

services.title: Our services
services.subtitle: We offer comprehensive truck dispatch solutions for owner-operators and fleets: from load booking and paperwork to route optimization and fleet expansion.

big_cta.question: Ready to move smarter?
big_cta.solution: Get a custom plan for your lanes and equipment. No commitments.

cards.title: Load Booking
cards.note: We secure daily profitable loads from top brokers and shippers, tailored to your lanes and preferences.

cards.title: Route Planning
cards.note: We minimize deadhead, improve average speed and design safer, more efficient routes so your trucks keep moving.

cards.title: Paperwork
cards.note: Rate confirmations, check calls, lumper and POD — we handle all documentation so you can focus on driving.

cards.title: 24/7 Support
cards.note: We work nights and weekends so you never have to wait.

cards.title: Payment Control
cards.note: Get paid faster with trusted brokers and factoring companies.

cards.title: Fleet Growth
cards.note: Advice on routes, RPM and scaling your fleet.

faq.title: FAQ — Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Answers for owner-operators and company drivers.

questions.q: What does a dispatch company do?
questions.a: We find and book the most profitable loads, negotiate with brokers, receivers and shippers, handle paperwork and provide 24/7 support.

questions.q: How quickly will I get my first loads after signing up?
questions.a: Usually within 1–2 business days after onboarding we start booking your first trips.

questions.q: How much does your service cost?
questions.a: Transparent commission as a percentage of gross revenue — no hidden fees. Exact terms are discussed individually.

questions.q: Do I need my own broker accounts or subscriptions? (owner-operators)
questions.a: No. We use trusted contacts and our own access to load boards and brokers.

questions.q: Can you help with factoring and quick payouts? (owner-operators)
questions.a: Yes. We recommend reliable factoring partners and help you choose the best terms.

questions.q: How do you reduce empty miles and deadhead? (owner-operators)
questions.a: We pre-plan load chains and returns, coordinating timing and locations to minimize empty miles.

questions.q: Do I need to talk to brokers directly? (company drivers)
questions.a: No. Your dispatcher handles all negotiations, confirmations and updates.

questions.q: What if I face a problem on the road or a delay at loading?
questions.a: We are available 24/7. Contact your dispatcher and we will promptly resolve the issue with the broker/shipper.

questions.q: Can I work only in specific lanes/states?
questions.a: Yes. We take into account your preferences for lanes, schedule and types of freight.

questions.q: Do I need a long-term contract?
questions.a: No. The format is flexible: you can test the service without long commitments.
Everything is online: short form, dispatcher call to clarify lanes and preferences — then we start booking loads.

questions.q: Do you work with new MC/DOT carriers?
questions.a: Yes. We have experience working with carriers who are just entering the market.

list.title: Acceptance of Terms
list.text: These Terms & Conditions (“Terms”) govern your access to and use of the dispatch services, website, and communications provided by We Dispatch (“Company”, “we”, “us”, “our”). By using our services, you agree to these Terms and our Privacy Policy. If you do not agree, do not use our services.

list.title: Services We Provide
list.text: We offer non-asset, independent dispatch support services to carriers/owner-operators, including but not limited to load scouting, rate negotiation, route planning, paperwork coordination, and communication support. We are not a motor carrier, broker of property, or freight forwarder, and we do not assume care, custody, or control of freight.

list.title: Eligibility & Compliance
text: You must be a duly authorized motor carrier with active MC/DOT, insurance (including cargo & liability), and all permits.
You remain solely responsible for safety, hours-of-service, equipment condition, and regulatory compliance.
You represent that all information you provide is accurate and kept current.

list.title: Bookings, Pricing & Payment
text: Your approval required: We will not book any load without your prior consent.
Fees: Dispatch fees/commissions are communicated in writing prior to service.
Invoices: You authorize us to issue invoices for our fees and to share required paperwork.
Factoring: If you use factoring, you remain responsible for all obligations under your factoring agreement.

list.title: Detention, Layover, TONU
list.text: We can assist in pursuing detention, layover, or truck-order-not-used (TONU) charges as applicable under a given rate confirmation, but we do not guarantee recovery. Final payment decisions rest with the broker/shipper.

list.title: No Brokerage / No Carrier Liability
list.text: We do not assume carrier responsibilities and do not issue bills of lading. All transportation is performed under your carrier authority. We are not a party to the carriage contract between you and any broker/shipper.

list.title: Communications, E-Sign & Consent
text: Electronic records: You consent to electronic signatures and records for operational and contractual communications.
SMS/Calls: By providing your phone number, you agree to receive operational SMS/calls; you may opt-out from non-essential messages at any time.

list.title: Intellectual Property
list.text: The website, logo, copy, and materials are owned by us or our licensors and protected by IP laws. You may not copy, modify, or redistribute materials except as necessary to use the services.

list.title: Prohibited Use
list.text: You agree not to misuse the services, including fraudulent tenders, misrepresentation of equipment/insurance, unsafe practices, or interfering with our systems or third-party platforms.

list.title: Disclaimers
list.text: Services are provided “as is” and “as available.” We do not warrant market availability, specific rates, RPM, lane volumes, or that any load will meet your expectations. You are solely responsible for operational decisions.

list.title: Limitation of Liability
list.text: To the maximum extent permitted by law, we are not liable for indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages. Our aggregate liability for any claims will not exceed the fees paid to us in the three (3) months preceding the event.

list.title: Indemnification
list.text: You agree to defend, indemnify, and hold us harmless from claims, damages, and costs (including attorneys’ fees) arising from your operations, cargo, equipment, compliance, or breach of these Terms.

list.title: Term & Termination
list.text: Either party may terminate services at any time, with or without cause, upon notice. Fees accrued prior to termination remain due. Certain sections (e.g., IP, Disclaimers, Limitation, Indemnity, Governing Law) survive termination.

list.title: Governing Law & Dispute Resolution
list.text: These Terms are governed by the laws of the State of Illinois. Exclusive venue shall be the courts located in Cook County, Illinois.

list.title: Changes to Terms
list.text: We may update these Terms from time to time. Changes are effective when posted on this page with the “Last updated” date. Your continued use after changes constitutes acceptance.

contacts.title: Contact
contacts.note: Questions about these Terms? Contact us:

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.note: This Privacy Policy explains how We Dispatch (“Company”, “we”, “us”, “our”) collects, uses, shares, and protects personal information when you visit our website, communicate with us (email, phone, SMS, messengers), or use our dispatch services.

text.text: name, company, email, phone, preferred lanes, equipment type, time in business.
load preferences, routes, documents (W‑9, COI, MC/DOT, rate confirmations, POD, lumper).
call logs, SMS, emails, chat messages related to operations and support.
IP address, pages viewed, referrers, approximate location, browser & device identifiers, cookies.

list.title: Sources
list.text: We collect data directly from you, from publicly available databases (e.g., FMCSA), from brokers/shippers you authorize us to work with, from factoring partners (if applicable), and via analytics tools on our website.

list.title: How We Use Information
text: Provide and improve dispatch services, including load scouting, negotiation, paperwork, and support.
Operate our website and measure performance (analytics, diagnostics, fraud prevention).
Communicate about operations, invoices, service updates, marketing (with consent where required).
Comply with legal obligations and enforce agreements.

text.text: to provide dispatch services you request.
to run our business, ensure security, and improve services.
for optional marketing, certain cookies, and SMS where required.

list.title: Cookies & Analytics
list.text:
We may use cookies and similar technologies to remember preferences, secure the site, and understand usage patterns. You can control cookies in your browser settings. Blocking some cookies may impact site functionality.

EU/UK users: On your first visit, you will see a cookie consent banner allowing you to accept or reject optional cookies. You may also change your preferences anytime via our “Cookie Settings” link.

list.title: SMS, Calls & Email (CAN‑SPAM / TCPA)
text: By providing your phone number or email, you consent to receive operational communications.

Marketing messages are sent only with your explicit opt‑in consent where required. You may opt‑out at any time: email — click “unsubscribe”; SMS — reply STOP; calls — ask to be added to our do‑not‑call list.

text.text: to tender loads and manage operations with your authorization.
to comply with law, enforce agreements, and protect rights.
in mergers, acquisitions, or asset sales, with notice where required.

list.title: Data Retention
list.text: We keep personal information only as long as necessary for the purposes described above (typically the term of service plus applicable limitation periods) or as required by law (e.g., tax and accounting rules).

list.title: Security
list.text: We implement reasonable administrative, technical, and physical safeguards to protect personal information, including encryption in transit (TLS) and at rest where possible. No method of transmission or storage is 100% secure; we cannot guarantee absolute security.

list.title: International Transfers
list.text: Your data may be processed in countries other than your own. Where required, we use appropriate safeguards (e.g., Standard Contractual Clauses) to protect data transferred internationally. Key providers include hosting and analytics vendors (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud, or equivalent).

text.text: access, rectification, erasure, restriction, portability, objection, and the right to lodge a complaint with your local Data Protection Authority.
right to know, delete, correct, and opt‑out of the sale/share of personal information. We do not sell personal information as defined by CCPA/CPRA.
contact us using the details below. We respond to verified requests within 30 days (GDPR) or 45 days (CCPA), extendable as permitted by law. We may verify your identity before responding.

list.title: Children’s Privacy (COPPA)
list.text: Our services are not directed to children under 13. We do not knowingly collect personal information from children. If you believe a child has provided us with personal information, please contact us. If we become aware, we will promptly delete such information.

list.title: Third‑Party Links
list.text: Our site may contain links to third‑party sites. We are not responsible for their privacy practices.

list.title: Changes to this Policy
list.text: We may update this Policy periodically. We will post the new version with an updated “Last updated” date. If changes are material, we will provide additional notice where required.
